alert.note: Alert for Allen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 1:49AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Simpson, northwestern Allen and southern Warren Counties through 115 AM CST... At 1249 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Portland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Warren, central Simpson and northwestern Allen Counties, including the following locations... Hardcastle, Allen Springs, West Fork, Greenhill, Settle, Yesse, Loving, Raley Ford, Butlersville and Trammel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for south central Kentucky.
